result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan A Smith

records.addlTxt: Order to show cause hearing on December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(9:07 AM cases 19CF1136, 22CF371 called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan A Smith in court. Attorney George E. Miller in court for Ryan A Smith.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Attorney Miller advises just met with the defendant for the first time this morning as was just appointed 3 days ago.
Attorney Miller advises needs more time and requests a continuance as may request an evidentiary hearing.
State advises will get discovery for both cases to Attorney Miller.
Order to Show Cause Hearing in 19CF1136 and Hearing in 22CF371 scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 9 am (3 hours).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney George Miller at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $50 beginning 07/01/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
(9:32 AM cases 19CF1136, 22CF371 called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan A Smith in court without counsel.
Court notes the defendant had an attorney on 19CF1136 but that attorney has retired.
Defendant advises does want an attorney. 
State notes case 22CF371 is set for a settlement conference on May 25, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Court orders bonds continue. Court advises the defendant is to go directly across the hall after court today to apply for an attorney.
Order to Show Cause Hearing in 19CF1136 and Hearing in 22CF371 scheduled June 17, 2022 at 9 am.

(10:27 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan A Smith in court without counsel.
Court inquires if the defendant wants representation. Defendant advises Attorney Bachman no longer practices law.
Defendant advises these charges are being dropped.
State advises that is not accurate and that one of three statutory victims has requested the case be dropped.
Victim present in the courtroom and requests the charges be dropped.
Court advises new dates will be scheduled and defendant should contact an attorney.
 Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on May 25, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No yelling arguments in the presence of the minor children A.S. & A.S.

Case called at 11:23 AM. 
Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan A. Smith appeared in custody, via video from the jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 4/18/22 at 1:15 PM.
RTN: 5/11/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No yelling arguments in the presence of the minor children A.S. & A.S.
